meanings.definition: Make (something or someone) unable to move or act.
meanings.sent1: The tight ropes were immobilizing the thief.
meanings.sent2: The cast on his leg was immobilizing his ability to walk.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved immobilizing his assistant in a box.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure can be immobilizing, preventing us from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The spider's venom had an immobilizing effect on its prey.

meanings.definition: Prevent (something or someone) from functioning or operating.
meanings.sent1: A dead battery can be immobilizing for a car.
meanings.sent2: The computer virus was immobilizing the entire network.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought it would be funny to immobilize the office printer.
meanings.sent4: The strike by the workers was immobilizing the production line.
meanings.sent5: The snowstorm was immobilizing traffic on the highway.
